topic.title: Power Saving Strategies and Modes

body.p: The device provides per-subsystem low-power, software reset, and IDDQ (for SERDES) configuration bits that are controlled from the top level. These power savings options are documented in the "TOP_LEVEL: Top Level Config & Interconnect" section of the Device Register Description document. By default, the device powers up in a low power state. Firmware and Software manage these features during device initialization and datapath provisioning.

Within each subsystem there are additional low power and software reset bits as described in subsystem and TSB sections within the Device Register Description. These provide finer-grain control over what is provided at the top level and may be used when only a portion of a subsystem is in use. See also the individual Subsystem Engineering Documents and Subsystem Register Description Documents for more detail and for Operations information.
